strings:
<se_low>Yangus: When I was travellin' about on me own, I often slept rough in the mountains.
But I don't much fancy that 'ere.

<se_low>Yangus: Can you feel it, an' all?
I reckon there's a lot more monsters 'ere than on yer average mountain.
<se_high>Jessica: We've got to take care of Dhoulmagus right away! Is hanging around here really the best way to spend our time?
<se_def>Angelo: I can think of better things to do than go hiking in monster infested mountains.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just try to get this over with as quickly as we can.
<se_low>Yangus: We've fought plenty o' strong monsters up to now, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: This Argon lizard should be a piece o' cake!
<se_low>Yangus: Charmless's got a bit big for 'is boots, wot wiv us around to bail 'im out!
<se_low>Yangus: Fancy moanin' to us that 'e wants an even bigger Argon 'eart!

<se_high>Jessica: You know how the Prince can't stand lizards?
I feel the same way about certain monsters.

<se_high>Jessica: Like, ones with lots of eyes.
Or slimy, gooey ones.
I can't even stand looking at them.
<se_high>Jessica: So. Why do you hate lizards so much, Your Highness?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hm, that's a good question.
It all started on my fifth birthday.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: I'd just been tucked into bed and was getting snuggly when I felt something strange under the covers. I pulled back my blanket...
<se_def>Prince Charmles: And I found dozens and dozens of lizards wriggling about! It makes my blood run cold just thinking about it.

<se_high>Jessica: Your fifth birthday?
So were they a present from someone?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Don't be so utterly ridiculous!
<se_high>Jessica: Actually, the Prince's penchant for running away is a big help during battle.
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, just imagine if he got hurt, or killed, you know?

<se_high>Jessica: We can't have that happening!
Not until after King Clavius gives us the magic mirror, at least.
<se_def>Angelo: I know you don't like them, Your Highness, but don't you feel like at least brushing an Argon lizard with your own sword?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Of course I do!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Of course I shall take the field! I'm ROYALTY!
Fine wine is still fine even if it's corked, you know!
<se_def>Angelo: That's right, Your Highly Esteemed Highness, your cork may be doubtful but you haven't lost your bottle!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: How dare you!?
I know you're making fun of me!

<se_def>Angelo: Those Argon hearts are quite pretty, actually.
Maybe I'll get one or two for myself.

<se_low>King Trode: Well, well! Now there's a surprise!
I never imagined you had an interest in fine jewels!

<se_def>Angelo: I couldn't care less about jewels!
I just think they might come in handy with the ladies.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: When you defeat a loathsome Argon lizard, you can acquire a beautiful gem called an Argon heart.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Returning from the royal hunting ground with an Argon heart proves that you are worthy to be the future king of Argonia.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: The larger the Argon heart I bring back, the greater the king I'll be!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: So I have to obtain the most humongous Argon heart I can in order to impress all those who ever doubted me!
<se_low>Yangus: Huh! That's wot 'e says, but we're the ones who're gonna 'ave to do all the 'ard work!
<se_low>Yangus: You betta apologise to the 'orse-princess about before, Charmles.

<se_low>Yangus: I know you wanted to ride 'er an' that, but ya can't force yerself on a lady, y'know.
It ain't right.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: What on earth do you mean!?
You're clearly deranged, referring to a horse as a lady, let alone a princess!

<se_low>Yangus: Look, just apologise, awright!?
That 'orse is like a daughter to old Grandad, an' 'e's pretty upset right now!
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph! Never!

<se_low>Yangus: The big boss must o' got narked at us bumpin' off all 'is little ones, eh!?
He came out to see us off!
<se_high>Jessica: Looks like we're finally going to get an Argon heart large enough to satisfy our young Prince's ambitions.

<se_def>Angelo: That cry we heard at the mountain top was no ordinary lizard call.
It must've been the head honcho.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: I bet the lizard we're about to fight is the nastiest one ever.
I order you to be on your guard!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: And don't you worry about me.
At the first sign of danger, I'll run off and let you all fight to the death.
<se_low>Yangus: Phew! Looks like Prince Charmless is finally satisfied.
<se_low>Yangus: Just between you 'n' me, I dunno 'ow much longer I could o' put up wiv 'im!
<se_high>Jessica: Pardon me, but don't you think you might spare a few words of gratitude for our defeating that lizard on your behalf?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph. Yes, I<endash> We<endash> I've done rather well!
Your assistance was quite valuable at times.
<se_def>Angelo: D'you know, I think I almost heard a thank you in there somewhere!?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Y-You brazen plebeian!
How dare you mock ROYALTY!?
Apologise this instant!

<se_def>Angelo: That was good exercise.
I'm not even sure I could have finished him off on my own.
<se_def>Angelo: But somewhere in Argonia's history, I should think there's been a monarch or two who could've defeated a great Argon lizard single-handedly.

<se_low>King Trode: Very good.
We've achieved what we came for.
We must return to Argonia!

<se_low>Yangus: You awright, Grandad?
Ya look pretty knackered.

<se_low>Yangus: They look pretty fierce at first.
I can't believe they leg it at the sight of us.
I mean, I'm no looker, but I ain't THAT scary!
<se_high>Jessica: Hey! What happened to that big lizard just now?

<se_def>Angelo: I don't think we should go after them if they go to the effort of running away like that.
No sense in forcing a confrontation.
<se_low>Yangus: So this is the way into the royal 'untin' ground? We should be seein' some o' them Argon lizards before long then, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: This is a proper 'untin' trip, but I ain't gettin' excited at all.
No nerves or nuffin'.
<se_high>Jessica: I know we're doing this for the magic mirror, but it just doesn't feel right.
<se_high>Jessica: No matter how you look at it, this is a sacred royal tradition. I really think a prince should carry out this duty on his own.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph! If you don't wish to help, then go!
I couldn't care less whether I do this or not.
It wasn't my idea!
<se_def>Angelo: This is so frustrating! Everything's taking so long. It feels like we're being made to jump through hoops.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just get this over with, get the magic mirror, and get back to the real business of dealing with Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: The initiation is supposed to be a way of demonstrating to the kingdom how strong their future King is.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: According to tradition, if I were to defeat an Argon lizard all on my own, it would prove to the people that I'm worthy of becoming King.

<se_def>Prince Charmles: But any fool could see that! Why subject the darling of the nation to such a barbaric ritual when his worthiness is so self-evident!?<page>Prince Charmles: This uncivilised rubbish should've been abolished centuries ago!
<se_high>Jessica: You mean, so that you wouldn't have to face any scary-wary lizards?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: You insolent rascal!
I should have known a commoner would come out with some rubbish like that!
<se_low>Yangus: It's a good job the 'orse-princess didn't collapse under the weight o' that stupid lump!

<se_low>Yangus: Eh, but did you 'ear that lizard callin'?
We'd better get a wriggle on over there an' give it a wallop!
<se_high>Jessica: I don't think she likes you much any more, Your Highness.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Huh! Why should I care what a stupid horse thinks about me!?
<se_def>Angelo: That Charmless character is a nightmare!

<se_def>Angelo: We should hurry up and find an Argon heart he's happy with, so we can be rid of him and have ourselves a bit of peace.<page>Angelo: Fighting monsters is a picnic compared to being with that brat!
<se_low>King Trode: I've never felt as regretful about my current appearance as I do at this moment.
<se_low>King Trode: Being here just brings back terrible memories. I don't want to stay a moment longer!
King Trode: ............
<se_low>King Trode: Blast and botheration! How dare that chubby, cowardly, contemptible excuse for a prince treat my beloved Medea like that!?
<se_low>Yangus: I wouldn't mind 'avin' a bash at fightin' an Argon lizard on me own now. Reckon I could bag a few of 'em wivout too much trouble.
<se_low>Yangus: Ah, but they don't like the smell o' people, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I bet that stuff Charmles give us wore off ages ago now, so I s'pose I've got no chance.
<se_high>Jessica: You know when Prince Charmles tried to ride on Medea the other morning?

<se_high>Jessica: That's when I knew.
There's no way she'll ever be happy, married to a man like him.
King Trode: ............

<se_def>Angelo: There's no sign of the Argon lizards at all.
It's almost as if they've died out.
<se_def>Angelo: Or maybe they're all in hiding. They were pretty scared before, so what must they think of us now we've thrashed the biggest of the bunch?
<se_high>Red: So wot, the Argon lizards around 'ere 'ave some sorta rare treasure, do they?
<se_high>Red: Int'restin'... Maybe I'll pay this place a little visit on me own once we've got things sorted.
<se_low>Morrie: Argon lizards are molto timido. They do not like to show themselves to people. Even I have not seen one of these monsters before.
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe it was not all sailing over the plains, but still...YOU have had the chance to pit yourselves against this rare beast, ay? You are the lucky diavoli!
